# READMEs, Licenses, and other files

<!--=================================================================================-->

## READMEs {.smaller}

- First point of contact for a new user/contributor with the code repository
- Should give essential information on 
   - what this software is 
   - what it's for 
   - how to get started
- In the best case it also tells you
   - who built/is building this
   - how to contribute
   - how to reuse
- Usually written in [Markdown](https://www.markdownguide.org/) as `README.md`
- See [makeareadme.com](https://www.makeareadme.com/) and [readme.so](https://readme.so/)
  for detailed information, examples, and tools


## Recommended README Content {.smaller}

:::: {.columns style="font-size: 80%;"}
::: {.column width=47.5%}
#### Essential:

- Name
- Overview of software
- Install and build instructions
- Usage/getting-started instructions (incl. simple example)
- Documentation and Support: User Guide/Website/Help/Discussion forum
- Information about contributing
- Authors and Acknowledgment
- License information
- Known Issues

:::
::: {.column width=5%}
:::
::: {.column width=47.5%}
#### Nice to have:

- References to key papers/materials
- Badges
- Examples
- Link to online docs
- List of users
- FAQ
- See [readme.so/](https://readme.so) for a longer list

:::
::::

## License {.smaller}

All public codes should have a license attached!

- `LICENSE` file in the main directory
- Protect ownership
- Limit liability
- Clarify what can be done with the code

The right selection may depend on your organisation and/or funder.

See [choosealicense.com](https://choosealicense.com/) for more information.

GitHub and GitLab contain helpers to create popular licenses.


## Types of Licenses {.smaller}

- Public Domain, Permissive, Copyleft

## How to choose a license {.smaller}
 
:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="70%"}
 - [https://choosealicense.com/licenses/](https://choosealicense.com/licenses/)
 - Permissive licenses:
    - Apache License 2.0 
    - MIT License
 - Copyleft:
    - Means that copy/adaption has to use the same license
    - GNU General Public License v3.0
:::
